Detailed Description

Initiates the simulation It must be a one copy of Initiation object and copying is prevented.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Initiation::Initiation ( const std::string &  project_name,
const std::string &  ivs_file_name 
) [explicit]

constructor

Parameters:
*project_name,: a pointer to the project name array (the project name is defined as a main-function argument and therefore given as an additional command line element when running the progam)
*ivs_file_name,: a pointer to the project ivs file name array (the ivs file name is defined as the second main-function argument)or to NULL in case no ivs file is needed (liquids simulation)

reading key words and configuration data from configuration file and assign them to the appropriate variable

if gas dynamics

read parameters of artificial viscosity

(line 104) this is only

true if h=cell_size (which is not necessarily given, as h, cell_size can be initiated independently in configuration file)

output information to screen

Member Function Documentation

void Initiation::show_information (  )  const

show information on screen

  • output general information on screen

  • output the timing information on screen

  • output iniformation on initialization mode (.cfg file or .rst file)

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Initiation::VolumeMass ( Hydrodynamics &  hydro,
ParticleManager &  particles,
spKernel  weight_function 
)

predict the particle volume and mass

mass initiation is different from 1DSPH code: here: mass is calculated by summing up the kernel function contributions for easch particle, which gives a kind of the inverse volume taken by each particle (not perfectly true at the discontinuity). together with rho (from initialization) a mass for each particle can be obtained. within the discontinuity zone, this mass varies because of the smoothing effect of the kernel summation. The mass for each particle stays constant during the simuation.

  • iterate particles on the particle list

    Todo:
    {initialize particle mass via initiation file...}

Here is the caller graph for this function:

Member Data Documentation

int Initiation::density_mode

density mode marker

  • 1: summation density (density obtained by smoothing),
  • 2: continuity density (density is integrated)

int Initiation::initial_condition

initial condition marker:

  • 0 initialize from the .tcl file (+.ivs file for gas dynamics);
  • 1 read from the .rst file particle by particle with non-dimensional data

int Initiation::integration_scheme

integation scheme selection

possible integration schemes

  • 1: leap frog
  • 2: predictor corrector

std::string Initiation::kernel_type

kernel type possible values are QuinticSpline, BetaSpline, CubicSpline, CubicSpline1D

int Initiation::number_of_materials

number of materials

  • the no. zero material is always the wall
  • therefore at least 2 materials should be included
